How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:If someone is aloof and self-important, what is their experience when meeting people? Choices:  A: stress B: nervousness C: smile D: being bored E: making new friends<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option C<n><n>### Input<n>The two children were talking: "I wonder if ______ is as tall as ______?"<n><n>One of the children said: "No."<n><n>### Response<n>Option A<n><n>### Input:"I have a new idea."<n><n>"That's great. Let me help you to ______."<n><n>### Option:<n>A: figure out<n>B: try it out<n>C: write it down<n>D: say it again<n><n>---<n>

Choices:  A: living room B: dog park C: basket D: small apartment E: big house<n><n>### Response:		Dog Park.<n><n>### Input<n>In the town of Wimbledon, on Saturdays, residents are allowed to park their vehicles on the street. However, if there is not sufficient space on the street, some residents' cars are parked in an adjacent residential district. How does the number of cars per resident compare when comparing a Saturday to a week without Saturdays? ________ cars per resident without Saturdays compared to a Saturday.<n><n>### Response<n>If there are no Saturdays, there are ________ cars per day, on average, in a town; and if there are Saturdays, there would be ___________ cars per day, on Friday, in the same town.<n><n>### Output:Write out the complete calculation that comes out with the answers.<n><n>Saturdays = 50% of 365 (days) = 182.5 Saturdays per year. So on Saturdays, there should be ________ more cars.<n><n>### Explanation:Answers:A 182.75 B 50% C 182 D 183 E 100 So on Saturdays there should be 183 more cars then when theres no saturdays<n><n>### Exaplanation:Answers A 183 B 51% C 183 D 183 So on saturdays there should be about 183 more<n><n>### Examplary:<n>Answers<n>A is wrong because it dosnt provide a sentence<n>B is wrong because its missing the "Answers:"<n>C is wrong because its missing "So on Saturdays there are 61 more cars".<n>D is missing "There is a 50% chance that a driver will want to park on the weekends, resulting in 45 more cars on Saturday than on a week when Saturdays occur. If the probability is 51% that a driver wants to park on the weekend and there are 7 days in the week, then there would be 41 more cars on Saturday than there would be to the rest of the week."<n><n>---<n>© 2021 Trilogy Education Services, LLC, a 2U, Inc. brand. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Sam went to Paris where he ordered a blowfish at a sushi place.  Where was Sam? Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n><n>### Response:		Sam was at a fish market in Paris.<n>

Can you calculate which is more? Choose between: A is greater, B is greater, The multiple of 9 is greater, The multiple 4 is greater.<n>### Input:multiple of 9 and 4 are 42 and 26. The multiple of 9><n>### Response: B is greater(multiple of 9=42 and 49>multiple of 4=26 and 24)<n><n>### Instructuion:You will be presented 2 different times for example 1x: 15min, 2x: 30min, 3x: 45min. Choose the option that have the same time for two times.<n>### Inputs:15min and 30min<n>15min and 15min<n><n>### Response : 15min<n>### Instructor:There is a triangle with sides 10, 11 and 12 centimeters and you need to color it. To color it you need to choose a color for every sides, the question is to choose the color of the triangle to satisfy these conditions:<n>-The color of 2 adjacent sides is different. In the triangle we have blue yellow green, the answer we need is yellow or green<n>-The color of a vertex i to be different from the colors of adjacent i to it. In the triangle all the opposite sides have the same color so the answer is yellow or green.<n>-All adjacent sides are different. The answer is green and the vertex color is red<n><n>### Input and Output: Triangle<n>-blue=12<n>-yellow=11<n>-green=10<n>-red=<n>-red=<n><n>### Response Green  or Red<n><n><n>### Instruitction:<n>### Input 1: How old was Nina when she was a baby?<n>### Input 2: How old is Nina now?<n>### Output: Nina is __ years old now.<n>### Input 3: How many years old will Nina be soon?<n>### Output<n>-12 years old

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Also, the answer the the question is "what was the name....".<n><n>### Input - What color is the star "Altair" in the constellation the "eagle"? Choices: 1. Green. 2. Orange 3. White. 4. Blue. 5. They decide to start by each taking turns to remove a letter from any word at random, and they keep playing until both dictionaries have a word where the letter remaining has no adjacent vowels, or a word with 3 adjacent vowels. By the end, both Boris’s and Cameron’s dictionaries contain a total of 53 words. How many words, in all, can be formed using as many as 6 words in a sequence by using only English letters, without repeating any letter, starting at any position, and without 3 adjacent vowles?<n><n>### 25,000,000<n><n>**Notes:**<n>**Example:**<n>* I don’t need to give you more examples<n>* Your solution: 1st part:<n>```<n>#!/bin/bash<n>COUNT=0<n>let "a+=$1"<n>while [ $COUNT -lt $1 -a $COUNT -ge 0 ]; do<n>echo $a|sed's|.|&|g' -n |wc<n>count=$?<n>let "COUNT+=1"<n>done<n>```<n>#### Sample input<n><n>> a<n><n>#### Sample output<n><n>```<n>6<n>5<n>4<n>3<n>2<n>1<n>0<n>```<n><n>### Sample input: Tapanga and corey have different types of flowers in their gardens. Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n><n>### Response:		Option C<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:Complete these instructions according the rules described.<n><n>### Rules:1. Input must contain letters and numbers.<n>2. Input cannot contain the special characters &,!,-,. or =<n>3. Input cannot be in lowercase form<n>4. Input cannot be in upper case form<n><n><n>### Demands:<n>1. 95/100 is 100%<n>2. 4 x -1 is -4<n>3. 2+6+4=12<n>4. 12-10=2<n>5. 38-9=29<n>6. 10 – 5 = 5<n>7. 75 – 70 = 5<n>8. 34567 / 347 = 100<n>9. 78 x 67 = 5276<n>10. 567 / 10 = 56.7<n>11. 7 / 10 + 9 x 100 = 7 + 90 = 97<n>12. 27 / 500 = 5%<n>13. 100 x 5 = 500<n>14. 11 / 2 = 5.5<n>15. 60 / 60 / 2 = 3<n>16. 110 – 10 = 100 (not required, but just to show that it is working with a string)<n>17. 83 / 34 = 2.434<n>18. 13718 / 13717 = 0.00014<n>19. 0.83 / 1.04 / 100 =?<n><n><n><n>##### Demand 19<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Instructon: Complete this instruction to the best of your ability.<n><n>### Demoinstaion:<n>Input: This task is to input number.<n>Answer: 0<n><n>Input: This task doesn't have any instructions.<n><n>Input: This isn't any instructions.<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: This Task is for you to

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What is an area with no grass where I can get things to sell at a roadside stand? Your goal is to calculate the sum of these numbers as quickly as possible.<n><n>### The program should be written to read 10 numbers from the keyboard and display the sum. If correct input is not received the program should prompt the user to reenter the numbers that were previously entered successfully.<n><n>### Additional Guidelines.<n><n>### *If an incorrect input is received the user should receive the response "Error, please enter the numbers again."<n><n>### *Your program will run 16 times in succession with an individual test suite to run after each test group.<n><n>### In each test, you should be able assign 0 or more points to each program depending on how well the program performed.<n><n>### For example, if a program is able to calculate the sum of a set of numbers correctly without crashing, 8 out of the 10 times the value returned should be 0, and the other 2 values could be anything.<n><n>### An incorrect response, or an incorrect calculation, must result in a program receiving a point deduction, but it is recommended that these be limited to no more than one out of every 5 test runs.<n><n>### You should score your programs as they run rather than at the end.<n><n>### Recommended, in order of best solution to worst.<n><n>### 10 Points - Sum of 10 numbers with no errors<n><n>### 9 Points - Sum of the 10 numbers when there is one error in sum<n><n>### 8 Points - Sum of correct numbers when there is another error in the program<n><n>### 7 Points -

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:The camper looked up at the vast night sky, it left him feeling mighty what? Choices:  A: unimportant B: insignificant C: stellar D: somewhat E: helpless<n><n>### Response:		1,2,3,4,5<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Which are more likely be considered a major work of fiction? He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? Sometimes they bring home leftovers from the cafeteria of some office complex or some place where they have a client meeting.<n><n>### Input I:There are 15 people on a bus. How old is the bus? Choices: 1: 8 years old 2: 18 years old 3: 28 years old 4: 38 years old<n><n>### Response I:28 years old<n><n>The driver is 24 years old, two ticket-takers are 25 years old, two of the passengers are 26 years old, two are 27 years old, one is 28 years old, one is over 29 years old, one is under 30 years old, one is between 30 and 35 years old, one is more than 35 years old.<n><n>### Response II:15 years old<n><n>The other 14 people are younger than the driver and less than 15.<n><n>### Note: What if my response contains more than one line? How would that make a difference in how I would answer this task?<n><n>### Input II:A large dog barks at a person. How many times did the dog bark? Choices: 6: 9 times 7: 12 times<n><n>### Response<n><n>I don't know. I know that when the dog barks, it starts making sounds, but then it stops, so it doesn't make sense to just count the number of barks because if the dog stops and starts again, it would show to have made more than one sound even though it only made two sounds: one after it stopped and another after it started again.<n><n>### What is the next step after I've completed each step of a task?<n><n>* Think about how you could represent each step with a step or series of steps on a computer that might be written in a programming language such as Python or Java (or something else that you have experience with or think you could learn).<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		<n>A clarinet, especially the bass clarinet, can be purchased at most music stores, but it is still very rare compared to saxophones, trumpets and flutes. For example, most people can identify a saxophone because it is an instrument that is commonly featured within most of today's popular bands. While a bass clarinet has a fairly unique sound that has been popular for over a century - especially in Jazz music, that doesn't make many other genres include the instrument within the ensemble. Many people may not recognize the bass clarinet right away so instead of browsing music stores looking for one, it is likely that if a person is looking to purchase an instrument they would first head right to their school band and search within the instrument areas of the school to see if one is available.<n>

Write a short response to the prompt.<n><n>### Prompt:A team of astronauts was preparing to explore a nearby planet. The team of astronauts worked together to complete repairs on their ship and to prepare their rovers. The repairs and preprations took 11 days. However, they discovered new evidence of life on the surface of that planet. For this, they took 5 days to come back to their ship. What is one day on the planet the astronauts explored?<n><n>### Requirement:Use 50-100 words.<n><n>### Your Response:<n>After years of searching, the spacecraft finally arrived at the planet they desired to explore. They would be able to study the planet’s makeup and hopefully find a sign of life. To do all of these tasks, the team of astronauts spent 11 days working together to complete the repairs on their ship, as well as to prepare their 3 separate rovers. They would need to take 5 days to travel back to their ship. Since the astronauts would all be working together on the same tasks, they would be more efficient.<n><n>

Provide two complete code lines that will run the process so that the user can test their answer.<n><n>### Task:Make an Instruction question.<n>Answer the following instruction question.<n>```java<n>#write code for the first line<n>```<n>For example, you wrote this:<n>```java<n>String firstPart = "write code for the first";<n>String secondPart="line"<n>```<n>Now, if you go to a testing station, it will automatically ask you to write code for the first line. <n><n>After you put the code for the first line, if you go back to the main page, the second instruction question will be asking you to write code for it.<n>This will go on like that until there are no more second line of instructions. After that, there will be nothing more.<n><n>### Example answer:<n>Instructions:Make an instruction question.<n>Write two more code lines that will run after you make the first instruction.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Use the same two code lines for the next line by using a.nextLine().nextLine(). <n><n>### Code for the main instructions:<n>String firstPart = "#write code for the first "; <n>String secondPart = "line of instructions";<n><n>System.out.println("");<n>System.out.print(firstPart);<n>System.out.nextLine();<n>System.out.writen("line is: "); <n>scan.nextLine(); <n>System.out.write(secondPart); <n>scan.next(20);<n>System.out.println("");<n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n><n>### Response:		<n>##### If you picked A, B, or C, then you may have to turn off your headphones for the next question.<n>If the ground is getting wet, you could be walking in a puddle of water or there might be rain. If you're standing near water, which you could also use as your answer, then you could have to walk in water.<n><n>##### If you answered E, then you are probably on a waterfront somewhere.<n>If the ground gets wet, it means that it is either raining on you or you are near water. If it is raining on you or there is water nearby, then it means that you have chosen to be outdoors.<n><n><n>### Input<n>##### Which of these foods have been made into puddles?<n>A: carrots<n>B: cabbage<n>C: raspberries<n>D: strawberries<n><n>##### Which of the following is a type of pudding? How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>#### Use the following code segments:<n>```<n>#include <stdio.h><n>#include <stdlib.h><n><n>int main (void) {<n>    int choice = 0;<n>    int i = 0;<n><n>    choice = getChoice();<n><n>    if(choice == A){ // A stands for attack<n>        printf("Fleas attack\n");<n>    }<n>    else if(choice == B){ // B stands for suck blood<n>        printf("Flies suck blood\n");<n>    *<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Code Explanation<n><n>This is a way to run a loop, the first 10 numbers in the sequence of the loop is `i` and the second is how many times will you cycle through it `j`.<n>### Code Samples<n>```<n>#include<stdio.h><n><n>void func(void);<n><n>int main(void)<n>{<n>    int i =5, j=3 ;<n>    func();<n>    printf("i:%d \nrj:%d", i, j);<n><n>}<n>/* Output of above program:<n>i:5 rj:3<n>The following program prints the even and odd numbers from 1 to 10 in separate<n>in a column:<n>*/<n>void func(void)<n>{    <n>    for(i=1; i<10; ++i) {<n>        if(i % 2 % 2 == 1) // odd<n>            printf("%d:", i);<n>        else<n>            printf("%d;", i);<n>    }<n><n>}<n>```<n>### Sample Output<n><n>**Output**<n>```<n><n>i : 5<n>rj : 3<n>```<n><n>##<n>

However, Tapanaga has 8 more candys than Cody. How many candys does Cody have?<n>* Answer: 29<n>* Explanation<n><n>Tapanga has 82 candys. Cody has 46.<n><n>The difference is 82 - 46 - 8 = 29<n><n>### Input : Question:Tapanga and Cody hve 66 candys toyether. However, Tapagna has 10 more candys

After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What happens when humans are exposed to noises? Choices:  A: pet the dog B: hear sounds C: have sex D: reproduce E: drive cars<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>In a study published by the European Journal of Epidemiology, 21,000 adults in Switzerland were tested to see whether or not the noise levels near their home had an impact on their health. The study found that, each year, the noise level above the 40dB mark caused depression and annoyance in about 300,000 Swiss residents aged 55-69. The researchers estimated that about 25,000 extra people will develop cardiovascular problems this year due to noise exposure. This is likely, as exposure to high noise levels has been shown to elevate blood pressure. Another study, this one published in the Journal of the American College of Nursing, found "a relationship between blood pressure and exposure to road traffic noise with noise levels in excess of 50 dB (A) reported to have increased levels of blood pressure that were comparable to the increased blood pressure found in persons with high workplace exposure to noise."<n><n>### Input : What would happen if humans had no legs?<n><n>### Response : C<n><n>If humans had no legs, they would use their hands to transport themselves around and the would have to crawl.<n><n>### Input<n><n>How to do division with decimals.<n>### Response

After donating their respective fourth and third of their books total, they now each have 9 books (24/4 = 6 books for Boris, 30/3 = 10 books for Cameron)<n><n>### Sample Solution<n><n>Boris and  Cameron now have 9 books each. They have a 4th and a 3rd of those (10 books in each). Therefore, there are a total of 20 books in the container. There are less books in the container. The container now has 8 books.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: alabama<n><n>### Instructor's response<n><n>**Write your responses using `python` language. The **function should be given a number and it will return a number, positive or negated, which is the difference between the given number and the number `input(n)`**<n><n>A single input can be handled by your function:<n>**import sys;**<n>**sys.stdin.read(1) # 1 = integer**<n>This will read from standard input, that is from the terminal, and convert the content to an integer. (This is called by the shell and is how you pass inputs to the function.)<n>**print(my_function(sys.stdin.reader(1)))**<n><n>*Example:*<n>**print(myfunction(-100))**<n><n>**Output:**<n>**5**<n><n>Note: It will output a positive number if the input value is less than zero. Remember if you are using two variables input in the function make sure that you are able to return a single variable of positive or negative value that is according to your input.<n><n><n>### What this means:<n>The function should be written in the **python language**.<n>The function must read the value through standard input as an integer value (between **1 and 100,000**).<n>The function should return a value of **positive or negative difference** according to your input.

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input<n><n>Tapanga and Corey each have 66 candyes together. Tapanga has 12 more candies than Coreys. How many candies each do they have?<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>Tapangal has 38 candies, and Corey has 38 candied each.<n><n>### Input 2<n><n>Freddy is calling his family in New Years Eve. He calls to his dad who lives in the same town. Freddy spends 5cents per minute calling local calls. He calls to his brother who lives in the other side of the country. This time he spends 25 cents per minute calling international calls. How much money did Freddy spend calling to his family inNew Years Eve?<n><n>### Response 2<n><n>The total expense spent is 10 dollars and 2 cents.<n><n>### Solution 2:<n><n>Freddy calls to his dad, and they talk for about 45 minutes. It’ll cost 5 cents per minute for local calls, which costs 225 cents. Then, Freddy calls to his brother, and they talk for over 30 minutes. The cost per minute is 25 cents for international calls, so the total expense is 825 cents.<n><n>Thus, he spends in total 10 dollars and two cents when calling his family.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>Freddie calls his dad, and then, he calls to his brother. He spends 5 dollars on local calls, and 2 dollars on international calls. The total expense is 7 dollars and 2 cens.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>$5 + $2 = $7$.<n><n>### Instructions:Complete each step given below for a given scenario.<n>Input: Ava and Caitlin are visiting the mall. They then spend 43 minutes walking to the cinema. How many minutes in all, did Ava and Caitrin spend walking around the mall?<n>Output: 91<n><n>###

B: In a cupboard. C: In the freezer. D: In Italy.<n><n>### Response3:<n>A is correct, B is wrong and the rest are similar.<n><n>### Output:<n>There was a pot used only for marinaro, where was it kept!<n>A: The South Pole B: in the fridge C: In a cupboard D: E!<n><n>### Output3:<n>A is Correct and the remaining are similar<n>

Then, if it is D then it should be C. Why? Because they give you the answer A-E and you need to read the multiple choice question and the other choices. A-E means they will ask something. We should know something from reading text.<n><n>There can be a similar question in an interview. For example, if I answer 'Teacher' to the question 'Where is a system of electronics likely to be used in schools?' then they will ask another question that is the same as above question.<n><n>## Checklist:<n>Use the table as a guide to determine what you will be evaluated on and review previous submissions of problems like the one addressed in this assignment. The maximum speed she is willing to drive is 65 miles per hour.  What is the maximum distance she can drive on one tank of gas?<n>Answer: 404 miles<n><n>### Input(A) The car’s fuel tank holds 26 gallons. Input(B) The car’s maximum speed is 65 mph.<n>### Output: If her car gets 270 mpg, then the max distance she would drive per gallon is 270. Because she wants to save gas, she doesn’t want to drive faster than 65mph. To save as much gas as possibly, she should go as slow as possible going 45mph because it’s the best gas mileage. Her range will be 26gal * (270 /65) or 637 mpg.<n><n>### Input (A) The man is driving. Input (B) The car is moving at 8 m/s. Input (C) It would take the man 35 minutes to drive to his destination. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. What are the missing information? Choices: B: How many people are in the class C: the person who is the average D: the person who is in the class<n><n>### Response Choice: B:There are 7 people in class I know that 10 is average D:The person who is the average<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. And in second place they should care for their kids and have a connection.<n><n>### Input How do people with autism perceive the world? Choices: 1. They are very clever but they often find it difficult to express their feelings or thoughts. 2. There is not much they see, they often have a lot of interests, but they don't take them into practice 3 The world is perceived in black and white, the light and dark colors, all with the difference that the people with autism often have trouble understanding how the world works and they can't do things like other people. 4.  They are often very intelligent and they can't understand their emotions.<n><n>### Response The correct is the 4 and the option is false. People with autism are very intelligent and can have very good emotional intelligence when they are treated and can develop, the world they perceive is not entirely black and white but with different shades.<n><n>### Problem: Which expression means the equivalent to $16.35? Choices:  A: play chess B: sun themselves C: wrong house D: set table E: gettable<n><n>### Response:		Children in Singapore may set table, sun themselves, gettable and walk to wrong house.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the sum of the squares of the numbers a, b, and b?<n><n>Input: a = 10 b = 10<n><n>### Response<n>The answer is 2410.<n><n>### Comment<n><n>### InputYou are hiking alone along a mountain trail in the middle of a forest. There is a 80% chance you will see a bear and a 20% chance you will not see a bear. What is the probability that you will see a bear?<n><n>### ResponseAnswer:20%<n><n>### CommentProbability of the occurrence of a bear is 0.8 and the probability of occuence of not seeing a bear is 0.2 <n>Let P(B) denote the probability that you will spot a bear and P(N) denote the probability that a bear wont be spotted that is 1-P(B).Thus<n><n>P(B) = 0.8<n>P(B) * P(B)=0.8x0.8 =0.64<n>P(N) =1 - 0.8=0.2<n>P(B) +P(N) =0.64+0.2 =0.8 <n>Thus the probability of you seeing a bear is 80%<n><n>## Input:How much cash is needed to pay for the following amounts? Answer the question: What is the total cost?<n><n>* 60.00<n>* 100.00<n><n>## Response:500.00 (600)<n><n>## Comment<n>* 107.00<n>*  265.00<n><n>Comment: the answer is 500.05<n><n>Answer: Total cost of items is 107.26<n><n>*60*1.2=72.00<n><n>*100*100=1000(as 1000 rounds to 1000)<n><n>Total cost 720.00 <n><n>## Comment:<n>*0.2 * 4 = 0.80<n>*0.05 * 23

She is going to the store to purchase milk but there is a possibility of running into another shopper that needs 6 quarts for cooking and 7 quarts of milk for their breakfast. How many different gallons of milk can Betty buy, without buying more than two gallons? Choices: A: 12 B: 15 C: 12 D: 25 E: 30<n><n>### Response B - 12<n><n>Betty needs to buy 7 gallons.<n>Another shopper needs 13 gallons.<n><n>13 + 7 = 20 gallons<n>20 - 20 = 0<n><n>So Betty needs to buy 17 gallons.<n><n>### To help with this part of the assignment, you can open up another question type and click 'Show answer.' Choices:  A: board ship B: shout at C: smile at D: cross street E: feel happy<n><n>### Response:		<n>There are several things that you can do to get the attention of someone across the room.<n>	• Choice A: You can board a ship is something that you would do if you were crossing an ocean or the Pacific. This is unlikely to get the person's attention when they are in a room on earth.<n>	• Choices B and C: Screaming and smiling are both actions that you can take to get someone's attention.<n>	• Choicing D: This suggests crossing the street. This may work in a public place, but you'd have to make sure that the person would see you.<n>	• Choosing E: This is an emotion.<n><n>### Input<n>How can you go faster than sound on the Earth? Choices: A: drive a car B: wear high heels<n><n>### Response<n>To go faster than sound on Earth you would have to travel at 345 m/s (1216 fps) using your shoes, or drive your car at 1027 m/s using a formula of V=24580/708.<n><n>### Choices:A 	B 		C <n><n>### Response <n>A. It depends<n><n>### Input <n>I have three red marbles, one yellow marble, and ten green marbles. I lost three marbles. What color marble am I holding? Choices:  A: bright B: pointed C: correct D: acute angled E: clear<n><n>### Response:		In my opinion, my answer is B.<n><n>### Input:"Invest some money to make a profit."<n><n>### Response:"In my opinion you invest money to save it."<n><n>### Input":"There is a 1 in 8 chance that you will win this game."<n><n>### Demostration:"There is about a 10% chance that you can win this game.<n><n>### Response"In my own opinion, my answer for this is C.<n><n>### Explanation:"A is obviously incorrect, and it's not bright. B is incorrect because the words pointed and obtuse can't really go together. C is right because acute means right or correct. And D is right because we are talking about acute angle."<n><n>### Exercise:<n><n>### This is one of the two exercises you had to submit at the end of the unit.<n><n>### Below is an instruction that describe a task. Write a short response that appropriately complets the request.<n><n>Instruction:A company has three different departments, including human resources (HR), marketing, and sales. The HR Department deals with employee questions, payroll, sick leave, insurance, and vacation requests. The marketing department handles the marketing campaigns. The marketing department, however, also handles the planning, market research, and selling of products to consumers. The sales department has 6 account managers as well as salesmen who handle the in-office sales. Sales also handles special deals and discounts.

Select the best answer from the list." <n><n>The Input is "Corey has 28 candies."<n>The list of choices for the Answer can be: A:Corey has 31 candies. B: Corey has 30 candies. C:Corely has 27 candies. D: Corey has 19 candies<n><n>### A:The appropriate output for the statement is A<n>### B:The appropriate output for for the statement is B <n>### C:The appropriate output forfor the statement is C<n>### D:The appropriate output forthe statement is D <n>### E:There is no appropriate output forthe statement. <n><n><n>### Example for the same Input: <n><n>Corey has 29 candies. <n>The choices for the answer can be: A: Corey has 29 fruits. <n>B:Corey has 27 candles. <n>C:Corey has 19 sandwiches. <n>D:Corey has 89 cats.<n>E:There is no appropriate answer for this

Choices: 1: 0 2: 666 3: 126 4: 77 <n><n>### Response - Multiple Choice:1: The response will be "0"<n>2: The response will be 1<n>3: The response will be an intermediate value between 3 and 4<n>4: The response will be a number divisible by 9<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>### Credits:<n>This solution by [kumar-punekar](https://github.com/kumar-pun).
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Reaching advantage position in a competitin puts me in what position as compared to others? Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>def getPosition(pos):<n>    if pos == 'A':<n>        return ['upper-hand', 'advantage', 'upper-hand']<n>    if pos =='B':<n>        return ['higher','superior', 'higher']<n>    if pos=='C':<n>        return ['determination', 'determination', 'upper-hand','skille']<n>    if pos= 'D':<n>        return ['advantage','superior', '\f0\f0','superior']<n>    if pos = 'E':<n>        return ['skil,'superior', "determi",'skil']<n>```<n><n>### Input2: What is the second largest number in this sequence? 1 6 24 120 Choices:  A.1 B.2 C.120 D.12 E.6<n><n>### Demo2:<n>```python<n>for i in range(7):<n>    print(i, end=' ')<n>print()<n>```<n>Output:1 2 3 4 5 6<n><n>### Response2:<n> ```python<n>from random import choice<n>n= 10<n>l= []<n>for i in range (n):<n>    l.append(choice(range(1,n+1)))<n><n>for i in range (-1,0,-1):<n>    print(l[-i-1], end=" ")<n><n>```<n>Output: 5 4 1 3 6 9 2 7 8<n>

In addition, the program should also determine the number of digits in the prime number entered.<n><n>The only restrictions for the program are that:<n><n>- The program should only run on a terminal and not on a webpage or app<n><n>- The code that runs in the terminal should start with the command 'python'<n><n>- The code should only read from input and print to standard output<n><n>- No other packages or libraries can be used (Python built in functions and math operations are permitted)<n><n>- The program files should only be named 'primesanddigits.py'<n><n>- Your program should print one prime number with 3 digits and any remaining prime numbers<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: headaches B: bigger brain C: education D: growth E: knowing more<n><n>### Response:		I will become smarter with more learning. A bigger brain, more education, more growth & knowing more all contribute to a smarter brain. If I can grow my brain muscle it can benefit me, for example if I can better understand a subject in class I will be able to keep up with tests & be successful. Having a better knowledge of a topic is something everyone wants to have. More education, bigger brain, etc will all contribute to a smart brain. Knowing more is the most important aspect of brains because if I know something thoroughly it will be easier to apply it to future questions, it may not be something I have to try to remember. Lastly, if I know more about a topic I will have better knowledge to grow my brain.<n><n>### Input 2:A study done, in 2014, showed that students who took a one week break after completing a test did better on the overall test grade vs students who didn't have that break. The students who took the one week break had a better understanding of the topic and because of this they had a higher grade. Choice: A: no break B: one week off C: two weeks off D: no change to break time.<n><n>### Response 2: I do not agree with the information in this study. I believe it is more important to continue on with the topic being learned. I have taken tests to see how well I remembered what was being learned. I would take a test one day, then two days later when I was supposed to be doing a new lesson the topic would be too fresh in my mind and I couldn't continue the lesson effectively. Therefore, I think the break should be no break like Option A. I think the one week off makes it harder to get into the zone of learning the new subject and because of this the new lesson will be more difficult.

Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. B<n>2. A<n>3. C<n>4. A<n>5. B<n>6. D<n><n>Input: 1. A 2. B 3. C 4. D 5. E
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>#### Reason:<n><n>### Inputs:<n>  - 3/4 of bags<n>  - 4/3 of bags<n><n>### Response Outcome:<n>  - 5 bags<n>```<n><n>### Input :<n><n>* "Michael makes birdhouses to send to his next craft show, and charges \$600 for each large birdhouse and \$75 for each medium birdhouse. After setting some aside and using some up, this is how much he has left:".<n>* "He sold 2 large birdhouse, and 3 medium birdhouse at his last craft show. How much does he make?"<n>* Answer:<n>```<n>"The question isn't asking what the amount left is. Instead, he is asking how much did he make from this craft show."<n>```<n><n><n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>* The instructions ask for what is the answer and not how Michael would answer it<n><n>* If we follow what the instructions ask for we will only find the answer<n><n>* Instead I will first identify the input and output. Then I will figure out whether it is a multiple choice question, or a simple arithmetic task.<n><n>* Example: the answer to the multiple choice is 29<n><n>* Input: "The number of days that a cat can hold its breath is 3"<n>* Output: "the animal that can hold its' breathe for the longest is a fish because a the number is 30 seconds"<n>* We can tell that it is a multiple choice because there is a question "How many dollars did Freddy [Freddie] spend calling his family" and that the instructions say that the answer is 10 (not how much or in dollars)<n><n>* I have done the same kind of task but instead of saying "Multiple choice" I will instead say a question has at least 2 possible answers<n><n>* If a question has at least two possible answers it's a multiple choice question (a.k.a a question with choices)<n><n>* Otherwise the question could be a simple arithmetic task. <n><n>* Ex. "After bringing eggs home from her store in what are they usually transported? Choices: <n> A: in the chicken coop B : in the box C : in the supermarket E: henhouse<n>D. In the egg carton"<n><n>*

Choices: A: A7536 B: A5796 C: A7246 D: A4726<n><n>### Response:[Choose the smallest number in any base with 0-9. 10 is larger than every 5 digit number excluding base 10, and therefore if 10 is added to 4 digit number the answer is 6 digit number. However with 0-9 numbers in base 2 10 is the smallest 5 digit in base 2 and therefore base 2 can be picked but must be base 2 excluding base 11 (10 is in base 11)]<n>### Input: In a study conducted by The National Center for Education Statistics, 45% of students entering 9th grade are able to pass a math proficiency exam. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		The bay you found can be found anywhere, anywhere around the lake.<n><n>### Solution:D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple answer question.<n><n>## Solution:A<n><n>## Instructions:Write 3 sentences about your choice that justifies your answer.<n><n>## Instruments<n>In this section, the questions asks you to do a task. What are the instruments required for the task?<n><n>* Example:<n><n>1. _______________<n>2. ______________<n>3. ______________ :<n><n>* Answer:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Choices:  A: walmart B: loft C: house D: home depot E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		10% of all answers are correct. Which means that the right answer would be D.<n><n>### Input 2: You are a gardener and you are looking for some good soil to plant your plants in. 10% of soil samples are good for gardening. How many samples do you need to take of your 3 acres of land in order to find the good samples?<n><n>### Response 2: 10% is 0.1. So if we know that there are 3 acres of land it'll be something like. 3*0.1 and then multiply by 10 and that should give you the answer.<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:The person turned the oven on and put a pizza in, what happened one hour later? Choices:  A: smell smoke B: catch cold C: burnt D: look angry E: bank savings<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Smell smoke.**<n><n>### Input : A dog can get hungry after 5 hours so your pet will eat. A cat's stomach needs to be fufilled after 6 hours, what do I put in my pet's dish to ensure they are fufilled?<n><n>### Response :<n>**Cheese.**<n><n>## Input: The dog likes to play with other dogs, it's a happy dog. The dog is looking at its reflection in the water, it looks so sad. How would you describe the dog in terms of: Happy, mad, sad?<n><n>###Response :<n><n>**Sad.**<n><n>## The dog likes to stay at home on the couch with a cupcake and a drink. What two things the dog like to do?<n><n>## #Response:<n><n>**Stay at Home and eat a Cupcake and a drink**<n><n>In order to write an output, we need to know if the output is correct or not. To know if an answer is correct or incorrect, we need a set or rule to refer to.<n><n>- **correct**: The answer should be a complete sentence.<n>- **incorrect**: The answer is not a sentence or it is incomplete.<n><n><n><n>## Instruction : Write a script and submit a screenshot<n><n>### Script to run on your teacher's computer : <n><n>- What happens at New Year after we set the clock? (A) Time changes (B) Watches get new clocks (C) We have to change calendar (D) We have to make a toast<n><n>- What kind of bird likes to climb tall trees? (A) Penguin (B) Parrot (C) Eagle (D) Owl<n><n>- What happens after we press the right arrow key on the keyboard? (A) We get a red car (B) We get a green car (C) We got a yellow car (D) We get a race starter<n><n>- We use the "back" button on our phones whenever we do what? (A) Play music (B) Switch music (C) Listen to music (D) Call someone<n><n>- What do we do when we want to make a new folder? (A) Create a new folder (B) Unlock it (C) Hang

When a snake prefers, warm sunny weather, where it likes to live in the pet shops.<n>### b. When a snake does not like to live somewhere warm like the sunny weather.<n>### c. When a snake wants to stay somewhere quiet and not in a cold place.<n>### d. When a snake feels really hot.<n>### e. When a snake doesn't like to go anywhere at all.<n><n>### Input.Maria is going on vacation. She wants to take her dog, but her dog has asthma, and needs to sleep near the open window at home. She lives in a room where the window faces into her house. Her dog has a pillow, a bed, and a soft rug to make its sleeping comfortable and cozy. If she wants to leave her dog alone for 4-5 days, what should she put by the window to make sure her dog is comfortable, and doesn't get asthma? Choices: A: dog bed and soft rug B: Dog bed only C: dog bed and soft bed D: dog bed and a dog toy<n><n>### Response.<n>### a. Making a cozy bed.<n>### b, Making a bed.<n>### c, Making a comfy bed.<n>### d, Making a cozy dog bed.<n>### e, Making a comfortable bed.<n><n>###Input: Which is a better way to keep your eyes safe in a fire? Choices: 1. Keep them covered. 2. Cover up your eyes with your hands. 3. Keep them open.<n><n>###Response:<n>### a, Keeping them covered for the safety.<n>### b Cover up your eyes with both hand.<n>### c Keeping your eyes up so that they don't get too close to the fire.<n>### d Keeping your eyes open and covered with both hands.<n>### e Keeping your eyes closed.<n><n>###Instruction:Input: Maria is taking a survey. They didn't have any other cups to put on it. He didn't have anything to put the cup on. He lacked the skill to balance it.<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>

Choices: <n>A: left hand  B: right hand  C: both hands   D: none<n><n>### Response; You can eat with both hands if there are enough plates.<n><n>### Write a Response<n>Tapanga has 8 less candies than Corey<n>Tapanga = 86<n>Corey = 38<n>108 = 29<n>Lawrence worked 8 hours each days for Monday, Tuesday, and Friday.<n>Monday = 5 <n>Tuesday = 8 <n>Wednesday = 5 <n>Thursday = 8  and Friday = 5<n>Lawrence worked each day = 10 hours<n>So on the 4th day he worked 60 hours.<n><n>Ali had a stock for 800 books<n>Sold on Sunday = 60 books<n>Sold Monday = 10 books<n>Sold Tuesday = 20 books<n>Sold Wednesday = 44 books<n>Sold Thursday = 66 Books<n>Therefore he is left with 7 books.

Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		<n>A -mouth<n><n>D -1 & 2, (3-5) & (21-24)<n><n>A-27 & 28, (3-5,6,15-18) & (23-25)<n><n>D-2 & 3, (4-6,7-10) & (11-14) & (19-22)<n><n>D -2 & 3, 1,4<n><n>A-2, 1 & 4-10<n><n><n><n>> **Note:** You can use any of the given numbers for any of the choice you like, it doesn't matter. <n><n>> **Note 2:** You can use the same choice more than onces, it doesn't make any differnce. <n><n>> It doesn't matter the order of the choices, just give any of them. <n><n>> You can use the numbers you like, you can use even or odd numbers, its not important.

Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		Computer Network<n><n>### Input<n>You work in a local grocery store. The customers have told the manager that they would like more fresh fruit in the fruit salad, fewer marshmallows in the salad, and more pecans in the salad. The manager has a large list of ingredients to use, along with a large list of amounts to use. They have asked you to make a "grocery list" that shows how much of each ingredient they need and the total amount needed for the entire recipe. How may you make that "grocery list"?<n><n>### Response<n>You can use addition or subtraction to come up with a subtotal for each ingredient. Then you add all of the subtotals together for all of the ingredients to get a total.<n><n>### Input <n>You have several bills to pay. You also want to save $100. What amount should you allocate towards each category to balance your bills and your savings?<n><n>### Response <n>You can use division to make them even. The easiest way to do this is to write down all your bills, and divide the total amount of the bills by the amount you want to save, then take the remainder of the bills and divide it by 2 until there is no more money that you need to allocate to saving.<n><n>### Question:Choose the option that correctly answers the previous question.<n><n>## Response <n><n>You can either use addition or subtractions to accomplish the "grocery list". The easiest way to do the "grocery ingredient list" is to make a total list for each ingredient, then add those all together to make a subtotal, then add that total to the grand total and make the grand total.<n><n>## Question:Choose the operation that correctly answers the previous input.<n><n>## Response<n>If the grand total is more than the amount to be saved you should reduce the amount to be saved in order to get them even. If the total to be saved will allow you to pay off your bills fully, you should take any remainder that you have, and save the remainder.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:A fox was thirsty searching for water during the drought, where was he? Choices:  A: painting B: hen house C: california D: virginia E: movie hall<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>Input: A boy and his dog had 40 sand dollars together and the boy has only 2 sand dollars left with him. How many sand dollars did the dog have?<n>Answer: The Dog has 38 sand dollars.

Choice D: There might be a bug in your address book.<n><n>### Response:"Because your email system might be out of order, your address might be changed or there might be a bug in you email address book"<n>```<n>That is a difficult question ✨<n>The email sysytem might be out of order<n>Your address might be changed<n>there might be a bug in email address book ✨<n>```<n><n>## How do you write your own functions?<n>### Functions that we already made<n>* square(x) returns the x² ✨<n>* square root(x) returns a square root of the number x ✨<n><n>```<n>The function squareRoot(x) Returns the square root of the square root of the number (x+3)<n>```<n>* cube root(x) returns the cube root of the number<n>* cubeRoot(x) returns a cube root of the number ( x +3 )<n>

This is a common problem that I have noticed in the past. As a response, I recommend that we automate this reading and weed out the non-correct answers. This would eliminate a large amount of reading that would need to be done on your part, as well as allow for a larger number of choice options.  <n><n>A:B:C:D:E:<n>

Choices:  A: owner B: foot C: subordinate D: base E: point<n><n>### Response:		<n>B: the foot.  <n>In my experience feet are often disgruntled and inefficient and can usually lead to the removal of a lower appendage; though, I'm not a doctor, I'm just saying that if you give a foot too much responsibility, they take over without being asked for it.  <n>Additional Feedback: The point was being yelled at, the owner is just above the foot, or is the owner? That's a terrible question. You should either be asked the name of the person yelled at or the position of the person yelled.<n><n>### Input:'Which is longer, the 500 page book, the 900 page book or the short chapter book?' Choices: A: the short chapter book B: the 900-page book C: the 500-page book D: none of the above<n><n>### Response:'C', which is longer, the 90 chapter book.<n><n>### Justification:<n>It may be a good idea to redefine "longest" as it seems that the chapter books are both the longest, with 900 page being longer than 500 pages. It might have been a mistake that I did not see the chapter book as long, as they did in the chapter books are like 200 pages a piece, with the 90 chapter books adding up to 1800!  <n>Additional Feeback: The point of the question was the shortest book. The longest book was, and is, the 90-page book

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What do you get for not moving your car during the required time? He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:James chose to not to print the cards, because he wanted to be more personal. What type of cards did he choose, instead? Choices:  A: cursive writing B: hand writing C: store bought D: online media E: hand written<n><n>### Response:		B<n>```php<n>if (($answer === $choiceB) ){<n>	echo 'Correct answer!';}<n>else {<n>	echo 'Wrong answer. The answer is choice B.';}<n>```<n><n>## The second step was to write a response that appropriately completed the request. My solution:<n>```Ruby<n>if (answer == 'B'){ puts 'Correct answer!'}<n>else {puts 'Wrong answer. Correct answer is B.';}<n><n>```<n><n><n>

The embarrassed person will not be able to help but tell people about the story because they will want to forget it. This will make the embarrassed person notorious and cause them trouble. Their actions will be remembered by everyone, and they will be looked at differently by others.<n><n><n><br><n><br><n>### Exercise:Write a program that allows a user to type in a message to be shared with others. Sin embargo, Tinga tiene 8 más que Corey. Cuanto golosinas tiene Corey?<n>Respuesta: 29<n>Input: Freddy llama a su familia el nochevieja. Llama a su papa, que vive en la misma ciudad que él, y hablan durante 45 minutos. Luego llama a su hermano, que vive en otro lado del mundo, y hablan durante casi 30 minutos. Las llamadas locales cuestan 5 centavos cada minuto, mientras que las llamadas internacionales cuestan 25 centavos cada uno. Cuentas Freddy la costura de llamar a su familia el noveveeja?<n>Respuesta: $15<n>Input: Lawrence trabaja 8 horas cada día los martes, miércoles y viernes. Trabaja durante 5 horas y media los viernes y martes. Como la cantidad de trabajo de la semana es uniforme, cuánto horarios trabajaría Lawrence cada día si trabajaba tantas horas.<n>Respuesta: 5<n>Input: Ali tenía un stock de 800 libros en su Roo. Vendió 60 libros el lunes, 10 libros el martes, 20 libros el miércoles, 44 libros el jueves y 66 libros el viernes. Qué cantidad de libros no las ventas?<n>Respuesta:1200<n>Input: Michael fabrica jaulas de aves para vender en ferias artesanales. Cuesto $ 22 para cada jaula grande, $ 16 para cada jaula mediana y $ 24 para cada jaula pequeña. Esta semana, vende 2 grandes jaulas, 2 medias jaulas y 3 pequeñas jaulas. Cuanto dinero, en dineros, obtuvo Michael esta semana?<n>Respuesta:$300E<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		 E <n><n>### Input<n>There are 300 chicks in a box. 88 are killed each day<n>if 5 of those survive each day<n>the box of chicks have how many chicks over the next 2 days<n><n>### Response<n>2 of the 300 chick chickens survives the 1st 2 days which are the 600th day and 601st day. after 2 days 7800 chickens. <n><n>###<n>### Input 86 + 258  = 344 <n>### <n>###<n>## Input:How much money do you have? I have $3.00 you have $10.00 which does not have the most?<n>A: $3.00<n>B: $10.02<n>C: $10.25<n>D: $10.45<n>E: $3.02<n>F: $3.25<n>G: $3.45<n>H: $10.35<n>```

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. You will be required to analyze the data to answer the given question.<n><n>## Examination<n>* Data collection:The city council wants to know whether their budget plan will provide enough money to pay for all their maintenance activities this year. They have data from each building for the following three maintenance activities. The budgeting director has already provided you with the monthly expenses for all three maintenance activities from 2011 through 2015.<n><n>Input:\[M=\frac{EA+B+C}{12}\]<n><n>Input:\[B=\frac{M*A}{T}\]<n><n>Input: \[C=\frac{M*B}{B}\]<n><n>Input:[T=2]<n><n>Input:[A=21440, B=23360, C=18440]<n><n>### Question: Based on the data given, will the budgeting plan provide enough money for all the necessary maintenance this year?<n><n>Answer:[y=-\frac{9582440}{21440}<-1.6945]So the budget will not provide enough money for all necessary maintenance this time.<n><n>* Examination:Learners will respond to 2-4 response questions and a 20-30 point multiple choice test.<n>* Scoring:Answers are evaluated for mathematical correctness and content.<n>### Exam questions<n><n>### Exam Question 1: What does the expression below represent?<n>* A. 18-108<n>* B. 15-22<n>* C. 108-18<n>* D. 987.654<n>* E. 0<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>* Exam Question 2: What is the sum of the whole numbers from 0-20?<n>* A.320<n>* B.0<n>* C.100<n>* D.60<n>* E.22<n><n>### Explination:<n><n>### Examples:<n>* 1:3=?<n>* A.0.5<n>* B.3<n>* C.3<n>* E.6<n>*

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A<n><n>### Instructions: <n>If the task is performed correctly, the program will print the following output.<n><n>### Output: <n><n>```txt<n>A is the right answer. <n>```<n><n>### Notes: <n>- The correct choice will start with a capital letter.<n>
