Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What does someone want when having fun with their friends and trying to fit in? Write your selections and the total cost<n>- A, $33<n>- B, $106<n><n>- C, $33, $44, $55<n><n>### Input, demonstration and output:When you visit a pet store, you want to buy a dog that cost between $33 to $55 and has between 6 to 66 candies. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input :You have a 3 liter, 6 liter, and 9 liter containers. How many liters do you have altogether? Choices: 1. 13 liters 2. 21 liters 3. 22 liters 4. 27 liters 5. 32 liters.<n><n>### Response :22 liters<n><n>### Input,2/3=0.66666 etc what is equivalent to the fraction? Choices: 0.006666. 0.6, and 0.333333%<n><n>### Response,0.666<n><n>

Choices:  A: train station B: baseball stadium C: lottery D: movie E: bus<n><n>### Response:		The answer is E.<n><n>### What we did:<n>The function we used to solve the problem is showQuestion.  <n>The data that we gave as input to the function was choices, country.      <n><n>### The expected result is :<n>1. We expect the answer will be the chosen letter as in the question below:<n>```<n>A: The name of the first country would be Mexico (choice A)<n>```<n>2. The expected result for the second question is:<n>```<n>B: The name of the second country would be Germany (choice B)<n>```<n>#### This function is able to answer those two questions from the given options.<n><n>### Input #1:<n>```<n>Tapanga has 88 candies, but Corey has 58 candies. There are 20 candies in total.<n><n>Tapanga: 28<n>Corey: 5  <n>Total : 20  <n>```<n>#### Answer: The answer is true since the total of both candies (20) is greater than the number of candies that Corey has.<n><n>### Output #1<n>```<n>Lawrence did 80 hours of work for three days, so he did 24 hours for each day.<n>```<n><n>#### Answer: The total of 80 hours is divided by 3 days. The answer to the question is 24 hours per day or 8 hours each day.<n><n>  ## Below is the second set of instructions that describe another task. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Why might a person go to get counseling? Choices:  A: to be heard B: receive gifts C: understand themselves D: good things in life E: acknowledgment<n><n>### Response:		Answers of choices "Counseling" and "D: good things in life".<n><n>### Explanation:Answer choices "B: receive gifts" and "E: acknowledgment" does not make sense since a person would get gifts and acknowledgment after having counseling not before because counseling is for a problem to be solved rather than a gift to receive or acknowledgment to gain.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What might someone do who is having fun? Choices:  A: being happy B: glee C: smoke D: stress relief E: may laugh<n><n>### Response:		What might someone do when having fun? Choices:(A,B): laugh (C,E): stress (D,A,C,E): smoke<n>

For example, "4 * 2" equals "4 *" then "2. "<n><n>### Multiplying a number by a fraction is the same as multiplying that number by the numerator of the fraction, then multiplying by the denominator of the fraction.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Input:"8 * (1/3)" Output:2.6666667 Output Format: decimal<n><n>### Instant response:<n><n>### Tap 1 if that is the correct answer.<n><n>### T<n><n>### Next Question<n><n>### Insturctions:Provide a logical interpretation/description of the expression below.<n><n>### It is the same as the expression.<n><n>### Inputs: (A) The sum of two numbers is 22. The first number is 11.The second number is: 1) 3 2) 7 3) 11 4) 15<n><n>### Response (A) <n><n>### Instractions:Write an explanation using steps of division of the following fraction.<n><n>##Explanation:"Divide" is putting the "65 250" on the left side of the division statement, and placing the remainder on the far right.<n><n>### An integer divided by a whole number other than zero is divided by the whole number in the same way as multiplication by the reciprocal of that whole number.<n><n>### For example, since 17 * 1/3 = 6, it is the same as dividing 17 / 3.<n><n>### Thus it is the same as 17 / 17 = 1.<n><n>### Since 35 * 1 = 35, it is the same the same as 35 / 1.<n><n><n>## Output: 17 / 65 = 0.266666<n>

Choices:  A: glass of water B: build evenly C: garage D: carpenter's shop E: video game<n><n>### Response:		Answer: C<n><n>### Explanation: I went to the carpenter's and picked up a shelf because that is the best option because its the only one on there.<n><n>### Input. Choices:  A: school B: large home C: house D: hat rack E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n>If there is a hat rack in your entrance hall then it should be the right place to keep your head wear. This is because the door to your entrance hall is the main point of entry to your house and the entrance hall can be considered as a miniature version of the entire house. The hat rack would be the best place to keep your head wears to avoid stumbling into your shoe and hat as you enter and exit you house.<n>An alternative answer to question 4 can be to keep your head wear next to your bedroom door if there is no hat rack.<n><n>### Input : Do you think that your mom would like to attend the family reunion? Choices: A) YES B) NO C) SHE IS IN CONTROL OF THE MEETING<n><n>Response: I believe that my mom would like to attend our family reunion.<n><n>###Input : What can we use to make our food safer?<n>Choices:<n>1. food coloring<n>2. food additives<n>3. the food safety inspection program for food establishments<n>4. a good way to test for spoilage<n><n>Response: All the answers are good options to make our food safter but I believe Food Additives are one of the best. According to the Food Safety Centre, Food additives are:<n><n>* Additives are used to preserve, enhance, maintain colour, control quality, or otherwise treat food – to keep food safe and to promote longer shelf lives.<n>* We depend upon additives to help keep the foods we eat safe and wholesome.<n>* Foods of animal origin, such as meat and poultry, may contain some additives as they are not generally subject to the same restrictions as food of plant origin. <n><n>### Input 1 : Aaron told his mom <n>I want to stay out later tonight<n><n>Then he added, <n><n>“Please. <n><n>Response: Please stay out later tonight so that I can go to sleep with peace of mind.<n><n>### Input 2 : What will we learn from our teacher who has taught for more than 15 years? ______________<n><n>Choices:<n><n>* About Maths<n>* About French<n>* Math<n>* French<n><n>Response: Math<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>You can use it to understand something or learn by experiencing it. If you change it, society will also change. What you need is one to do. Because many things have happened, this can lead to change.<n><n>### Input A: The first 20 prime numbers in the sequence in which they appear are: What is the 21st prime number?<n><n>### Response A:<n><n>79<n><n>### Input B: A computer's processor core can generally compute what number of calculations per second? Choices:  [B] 100,500, 1000, and 10,000.<n><n>### Response B: 1000<n><n>### Input C:A normal adult human has how many ribs in their body? Choices: . 12 12 11 13<n><n>### Response C: 12<n><n>### Input D: The human nose can detect what? You should write a response that correctly states which option would happen.<n><n>### Answer key: <n>A: Spinning wheel does not lay in an orientation between A & B, C is not a lieing down position.<n>> [D] "Doesn't really work with how elevated means lying down"<n>> "This may be the situation where the leg is elevated, as is done when someone is in a cast. It is not a lieing position though"<n><n>> D: does not make sense.<n><n>### Comments:<n>Commenter 1:<n>"Is there a different response between elevated (like in a cast) and lying down?"<n>"The answer seems to be wrong, does it mean something like "which of the following options happens when someone is broken and lying down?""<n>Commenter 2:<n>"It definitely should say lieing down"<n><n>"What would lieing down look like out of those options?"<n>> "Legroom seems like the closest, but if lieing down means laying on your back, then maybe you could say on a hospital bed."<n>\end{code}<n><n>There are more comments but these are the main points. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:He had an index card he had to return, so where did he put it after finding the book he needed? Choices:  A: inside the book B: oral report C: library D: fileing cabnet E: card catalogue<n><n>### Response:		He put it in inside the book.<n><n>#### Instruction:How many marbles did Nicole have when she put 12 in her box after her friend had played with it?<n>Response:She had 24 marbles then then friend had played with it and so she put 12 back.<n><n>#### Instructions:What is.25 x 42?<n>Response:.25 times anything means I have to flip an operation, so this would be equivalent to multiplying 42 x.25<n><n>#### Instrucation:Sally has 34 fewer marbles than her sister. Her sister had 28 marbles. How many does Sally have?<n>Response:Sally has 7 less than her sister has and this question is asking for 34 - the original amount.<n><n>#### Instuctins:Abby has a collection of pencils of 33 and she gives 7 to her friends. How many does she have now?<n>Response: The question is asking for 26.<n><n>#### Instructins:The number of marbles in a group is 51. The girls added 13 more marble into the group. How many marbles, in total, are now in the group?<n>Response:52<n><n>#### Instructiont:Nicholas is putting 11/12 of his marbles away in his bin after a friend asked to play with some of them. Afterwards, he realizes he put 34 more in his bin than originally, and puts 4 of them back. How many marbles does he now have in his bin?<n>Response: He now has 30.<n>

It is not a rule, it is a common mistake, but negative or odd numbers can be in the form of (2^n).<n><n>Input: The square root of a number must be equal to the number itself.<n>Answer: false (the square root of a negative number is always a negative square root, not the actual number)<n><n>Input: The difference of 2 positive or negative numbers is always a positive number.<n>Answer: false - if the difference of 2 positive numbers is 2 and 2<1 then its a negative number<n><n>Input: If we take the square root of two negative numbers, like (-4) or (-2), then we get a positive number.<n><n>Answer: false<n>> The square root of a negative real number is a negative real number, not a positive.<n><n>### Question:<n>Input: Given the following numbers: 3.14, 30, 2, 11, 90, choose the correct answer: What is the value of (3.14^(30) * (2^(-11))/(90^-1))?<n>Answer: 0.496<n><n>### Question<n>>Input: Choose the correct answer: Which of the following operations does NOT change the value of a number?<n>><n>>Answer: multiply by a negative number<n><n>### Instructor's Answer:<n>### Given the following numbers: -7, 7, -2, 2, what is the value of (-2)(2)(7)(7)?<n>### Response:<n>### The answer must be 49 because no matter how many ways you try, 2 cannot be divided

To summarize data obtained from a survey<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>A,B,C,D<n><n><n>### What is the purpose of a paragraph?<n><n>### It helps to organize your thoughts and can help make for a smoother flow and better read.<n><n>### To express different steps of a problem or instruction.<n><n>### It contains a single idea or argument.<n><n>### A paragraph can be defined as a group of sentences that <n><n>### ____________:<n><n>### contains a single, main point; provides relevant details that help explain it; and uses cohesive transitions and logical structure.<n><n>### What are three elements of a well constructed paragraph that helps it accomplish its purpose?<n><n>### 1.A topic sentence <n><n>### It is necessary for each paragraph to begin with the main topic sentence.<n><n>### 2.Supporting details<n><n>### The topic sentence needs to be followed by supporting details.<n><n>### These are sentences that provide support for the main point of the paragraph.<n><n>### How many paragraphs are there in this paragraph?<n><n>## A. 2<n><n>## B. 3<n><n>## C. 4<n><n>## D. 1<n><n>### Choice:<n><n>A,C,A<n><n>### Paragraphs need a minimum of<n><n>### How could you change the structure of the following paragraph to help it achieve its purpose?<n><n>"I was running late for school, so I decided to take a shortcut through the woods. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:James was looking for a place to buy bitcoins.  He searched and found a large menu of what? Choices:  A: advertisement B: news C: bar D: cafe E: internet sites<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:bitcoin seller seller<n><n>### Instructions:<n>A list of four bitcoin seller companies.  <n>Pick the correct company?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Choices: Coinmama B: Bitstamp C: Circle D: itBit<n><n>### Input<n>James then bought 15 bitcoins. <n><n>### Input : <n>James then sold 18 bitcoins. how many bitcoins did he keep?<n><n>### Insttruction:<n>Write three lines of code to complete the following task.<n><n>### Demo:<n>First, prompt the user for an integer. Second, store the user's input in a variable, and then compare this variable to the correct answer and print a message to confirm the answer is correct. Repeat this process until all six tests have been completed. All users must pass ALL of the given tests. <n><n>## Input:<n>15. 6.  3.  68.  12. 97. 53.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>1) Prompt the end user for an integer.<n>2) Store the user's input into a variable.<n>3) Compare the user input to the correct answer and if the answers are equal then print a message confirming the answer is correct.<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>1)User enters 15 2)15 equals 15<n>3)User enters 66 4) 67.51 equals 66<n>5) User enters 67 6) 67.23 equals 67.25<n>7)User enters 68 8) 67.74 equals 67.75<n>9) 67.33 equals 67<n>10) User enters 69 11)68.25 equals 68.33<n>12) 45.5 equals 45.5<n><n><n><n><n>### input:<n>Tell how many days it took from the first to the last of April if there are 6 weeks in a month.<n><n><n>### Demosition:<n>Days = 4 weeks = 28 days <n><n><n>### inputs:<n>How many hours to spend each day

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. In the last two lines (y, z),  <n>the string length is  <n>8  <n>and the string length is  <n>7.  <n>  <n>Which of the following methods of string concatenation would print  <n>"string1string2string3" on a single line?  <n>I. <n>s = "string1string2string"  <n>print (s+"string3")  <n>II.  <n>s = "String" +  <n>"1" + "string" +  <n>"2" + "string3"  <n>print(s)  <n>  <n>What is the output? Choices: A: str1str2str3 B: string1string2string3 C: string 1   <n>string2   <n>string3<n><n>### Response <n>I and II work equally well.<n><n>### Summary
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:When a monkey is taken away from their home they are often brought to this place where people wear white coats. Choices:  A: rain forest B: research laboratory C: cage D: treetops E: south africa<n><n>### Response:		Choice (B) Research Laboratory<n><n>Input: Choose the missing number from the set. {9, 12, 15, 24,28}<n><n>### Response 1: 18<n><n>Input: Write the missing number from {3, 6, 12, ___, 20}<n><n>### Solution 1: 4<n><n>Input: Which number did you pick? Choose only one answer Choices:  A. One B: 14 C: 57 D: 90<n><n>### Response D Choice (A) One<n><n>Input: Write a number. Your friends pick numbers. One says "I chose a number that is 10 fewer than mine". Another says "I chose a 2 digit number that is 46 fewer than mine". The final number is 32. Which digit is different between each of your friends number?<n><n>### Solution: 1<n><n>Input: Write your new number A: 93 B: 64 C: 32 D: 39<n><n>### Response A: 93<n><n>Input: Which statement is true for the sequence? {8, 9, 10, 11, 12, _, 13, 14}<n><n>### Choice (A) _=12, 13, 24, 25, 43, 45_<n><n>### Response B<n><n>Input: Write another number. Now your friends choose new numbers. Your number, your friends' numbers are 48, 93, _, 250, 366<n><n>### Response C: 74<n><n>Input: Write 1/6 = __<n><n>### Response (B) 3/6<n><n>Input: 2 × =? Choose one answer. Choices: A: 2 B: 5 C: 8 D: 13 E: 17<n><n>### Response E: 2 x 10   = 20 is the next term 20 + 20 + 17  =  57<n><n>Input: Write ___ x __ = 380 <n><n>### Choices:<n>Choices: A:  64   x  
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Where did the person have to walk downstairs to get the tool? Choices:  A: hardware store B: basement C: garage D: repair shop E: the library.<n><n>### Response:		If he had walked downstairs to the library, the answer would be A: hardware store.<n>

E: It's a more balanced diet.<n><n>### Response A<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Justification: After the first sentence, we have no more information. It is assumed that she will invite her friends on Friday.<n><n>### Input:"My mom makes 400 dollars a week and gets raises when she hits her benchmarks. If she gets a raise when she hits 50, 90, 140, 180 and 220, how much money does she make after her 220th workday?" Choices:A: 60 $B: 30 $C: 600D: 330E:470<n><n>### Response:"B"<n><n>### Justifaction: The first sentence states that when her mom hits 50 benchmarks, she gets a raise. Next we have information that her mom worked for at least 220 days and that she worked for 400$ per week. The question is then how much money she made at the 220th day. If the total sum of the information after the 220 day is 400+220=620, then the new wage should also be 620+60=680, which is the answer that we need.<n><n>### Question:"I'll take this opportunity to wish you well with your next exam, however to take these into consideration this exam is the last test you have to complete to get your promotion? Choices: A: Good Luck B: Best of luck C: Wish you successD: I wish you luck E: Well Wisher<n><n>### Response":"E" <n><n>### Justificaion: Every statement is the wish to do well on the test. First the person saying good luck wishes the person good luck (A), then the rest of the sentences are either good luck or best of luck which is all the same (B, C, D) and finally the sentence is closing with a "Well Wisher" (E), which means that she/he wishes you well. (In a manner of a greeting or saying goodbye).<n><n>### Question: "I will help you build your house on Thursday. We may decide that we'll meet in the same place where we live, or that we'll work separately. The first idea will have advantages and benefits over the second option

Choices: 0<n>    1<n>    7<n>    20<n>    C<n>### Response: The correct answer is: choose 20<n><n>### Input - In the last 19 years, the stock market has gone up an average of 8 percent each year. If you invested $2000 in it 3 years ago, how much is that same $2000 worth today?<n>###<n>### Choice (A) $2500<n>### Choice(B) $2416<n>### Choice C ) $2649<n>### Choice D) $2000<n>### Answer : D) $2016<n><n><n>### Input-Jane works at a salon and charges a $77 haircut and a $100 manicure. Write what is the cost for an appointment at the salon?(Choices: $77<n>        $192 <n>        $243<n>        $352<n>        $572)<n>###<n>##Choices are; $192<n>##Response is $192<n><n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Where is the strategic gold reserve in the U.S.? Choices:  A: jewelery B: fort knox C: church D: jewelry store E: treasure chest<n><n>### Response:		The answer is: E (treasure chest)<n><n>### Explanation: The answer is "E"<n><n>### Input-Data-Structure:Where is the strategi gold reserve in the U,S.?<n><n>### Output:The answer is :E <n><n>### Exmaple:Input :Where is the strategic Gold reserve in the U,s?<n><n>### Exprexample:Output :<n>The answer is E.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:If electrical equipment won't power on, what connection should be checked? How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Answer: 74<n>*Expalnation: 70% of the number 105 is 74<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Exaplanation:<n>*The percentage of how much of a value is 25%, the value of which is 25. The percent is equal to the number the value being divided is divided by the whole.<n><n>### Example<n>A: 5% of 4<n>2.5% of 5<n><n>B: 65% of 145<n>7% of 32<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Percent is equal to a number the original number.<n><n>### Explination:<n>4% = 4/100 =.04<n>Divide by 100 and you will get a fourth<n><n>### Expanation:<n>*Example: 25%/4 gives 25%/100 which is.25<n><n><n>### Instructon:<n><n>You work at a local grocery story and you earn $20 an hour plus 20 cents for every additional hour you work, up to 35 hours per week. How much money do you earn everyday you work?<n><n>### Exlanation:<n>I have to take $20 and add a quarter on every additional hour worked, up to 3.5<n><n>### Explantion:<n><n>*100+$6.50 which is equal to $106.50<n><n>### Instraction:<n>You have a bank account with $4,500.00. The interest on your account is 1%<n>. How much money will you receive in a year?<n><n>### Explaination:<n>I need to take the interest of 1% and multiply it by the $4,50,00, which is how much I have in my

Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n><n>### Response:		What is a slow but cheap way to transport large cargo?<n>Choice: Ship's hold

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What is a useful activity when experiencing loneliness? Choices:  A: meet people B: meet friend C: make people laugh D: socialize E: liquor<n><n>### Response:		A: meet people<n><n>### Output:<n><n>Write a Python program that takes as input 8 numbers from 0 to n2 (the last one is n2-1). Then, output the smallest number n3 in the range from 0 to n, such that that number divides evenly into the first number that is smaller than it.<n>### Input: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8<n>### Output:6<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>n = int(input())<n><n>res = pow(2, n-1)<n>min1 = pow(2, (n-1)-1) # 1 is the smallest<n><n>l = [i for i in range(min1, res, 2)]<n># [i for i in l]<n><n>if sum(l) == (n-1) or sum(l) == 0:<n>    print(res)<n>else:<n>    print(sum(l)/2)<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a program that reads the integer 6 and then, prints out the total number of ways in which it can be expressed using these variables: x, w, c, and d. The variables x, w, c and d represent an expression that is made up of four separate variables and numbers in the following way: x, 1; w, 2; c, 3; d, 4. The values of these variables cannot be greater than 5. All other values are allowed.<n>Input: Input 6<n>Output: 31288680<n><n><n>### Instctions:<n><n>Write the Python code that is capable of receiving the values of x, w, cand d and then, prints out all 64 possible variations of the numbers.<n><n>### Inputs: x:4 w:2 c:2 d:2<n><n>### Outputs: x:4   w:2   c:2   d:2   <n>3 x 2 + 2  x 2 + 3  x 2 + w 2 + 4  x w  + 4  x d  + 4 *<n>5 x 2 + 5  x 2 + c 2 + 5 +  6  x  5  +  6  x

Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Explanation:<n>If you want to buy deodorant, then you should visit the place where you usually store deodorant, which is commonly the medicine cabinet. The first time I ever used deodorant was in my childhood in my parents' house, in my mom's bathroom. My dad's name is Tom. When my dad found out that I was going to start using deodorant, he told me to store it where my dad usually stores his.<n><n>### Input<n>If my friend wanted a new table, and she could not afford it herself, what does she have to do in order to buy it at a lower price? Choices: A: Sell her old table at a garage sale B: Ask her parents if they have a table to sell C: Ask her parents if she can borrow money to buy the table D: Ask her parents for the money to buy it E: Borrow money from her parents<n><n>### Response<n>C: Ask her parents if...<n><n>### Explantion<n>If you want to get something you want at a lower price than you can afford to buy, then there are three steps or methods you can use:<n><n>  1) Find items or products that are on sale for really cheap. There are several ways to get items at a lower price with the first way being to buy it during a sale.<n>  2) Ask one of your parents if they can help you buy something you really want.<n>  3) You can find another person that you can give something of yours (such as chores, games, or clothes that you don't want anymore) to in exchange for them helping you buy something.<n><n>### Reference<n><n>Reference: https://quizlet.com/482588960/2-digits-numbers-skills-flash-cards/<n>

Choices:  A: restorand B: wedding party C: church basement D: corridor E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		You can find out by watching who the restorant serves at the table. If the people being served are at table A, it's a food serving restorant.<n><n>### Inputs:You are having a birthday party for a 4 year old. There will be four girls and two boys attending the party. You will need to have a cake with eight candles on it for the party. One more child than the number of girls will receive a gift. How will you assign gifts and candles?<n><n>### Response  :You ask for who has the most number of candles on the cake to start with. Then you count down until there is the desired number of candles for each cake and the remaining candles.<n>

Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n>1.<n><n>E<n>Because all of waterfalls are not covered by water and the waterfalls are in the land and not in the sea. The other choices are also incorrect including underwater and beach because underwater doesn’t cover by water and beaches are in the land.<n><n>2.A.<n><n>B<n>Because 5/8 of the population is over 60 years old so that the population of people is 60 years old over. And 60 is equal to 80% of 75 so that 80/100 is greater than 5/8.<n><n>3.<n><n>B<n><n>Because three quarters of what are cover by oceans is three quarters of the surface of the earth so that the sum of cover is bigger than the surface of the earth. On the other hand, three quarters of waterfalls is less than three quarters of the ocean<n><n>4.<n><n>D<n><n>D<n>Because the sum of them are:<n>\((\frac{3}{4})+(\frac{1}{60})=(\frac{75}{40})+(\frac{2}{30})\) so that the sum of them is the same.<n><n>5.<n><n>None A to D because it is irrelevant.<n><n>6.<n><n>B.<n><n>B<n>because it could be more than 38 and even 2^x could be less than 37.

Choices:  A: front pocket B: cabinet C: purse D: chain E: piano<n><n>### Response:		C<n>### Explanation:<n>Let A be the keys and B be for the black<n><n>B means black<n><n>A*B would be all the keys that could be black<n><n>B has to be something else to be a white key than a black key<n><n>### Input Choices: A: crank B: leaver C: cake D: button E: faucet - Answer D<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>The answer is D because to open the faucet you need to turn the knob<n><n>### Question<n>### Task: What types of information is represented with each choice?<n><n>### Answer:<n>B: Number, quantity, size; D: Symbol, letter; E: Number, quantity, location, distance, size, relation; F: Symbol, number, letter, relation; G: Quantity, size; H: Quantity, size, relation; I: Symbol, letter, number<n><n>### Question:What are the common mathematical relationships between choices?<n><n>### Response<n>In all the inputs we have been given, all of them are real-life things, they are not abstract. The only one that is not real-life is the question about the knob at the faucet<n><n>### Question Answer:<n>All of them are representations of real-life things, except for the option at the faucet because it does not have anything to do with real-life.<n><n>### Question Input Instructions:Choices: Choices (A, B,..., Z)<n>

Choices:  A: symphony B: band C: create music D: orchestra E: string quartet<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In a sentence, show the reasoning for why your answer is correct.<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>Correct<n><n>The viola is a string instrument and it is played alongside violins, violas, cellos and basses. I know this because I took an instrumental class in school.<n><n>### Wrong(?)<n><n>Incorrect<n><n>Symphony is a song where a lot of brass instruments are played like trumpets, trombones, tubas and the drum is also used.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>A symphony is a composition for an orchestra but the viola is not a brass instrument, it’s a string instrument.<n><n># Questions<n>Input:  Michael takes care of 30 dogs and they cost him $5,134.32 in total each year. This answer is very straightforward. If the user chooses this option, there is no need to ask for further input.<n><n>**The response in choice D**<n>According to dictionary.com, the definition of a human is someone in the Homo sapiens species who is capable of independent action. By this definition, humans cannot lay eggs, so this is the logical choice that follows this definition and will be the appropriate answer.<n><n>If the user does not select (A or D), then there is a fifth choice (E), the one which requires input from the user. In order to get this answer, the user must know whether or not the human will select (B or C). If the user selects (B), he must input the correct amount of feet the human is expected to have. If the human answers (C), he must input the number of ears he is expected to have on the side of his head. We have not provided this answer because this answer depends on what choices the user selects. Therefore the response is, “Sorry, I do not know.”<n><n>**The response for the other option**(B or C)<n>If the user selects one of the two answer choices that require a response, then he or she must input this information to receive the correct answer. When the user selects (B or C), he or she must input the number of feet and number of ears that the human will have.<n><n>**The summary**<n>The human will have 2 feet (A, the answer to option (A)) or no feet at all (D, the answer to option 5). He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>You should not walk barefoot after the rain because your feet will get wet. <n>```<n><n>### Example:<n>**Input:** 3 cats had 4 babies, 8 babies had 5 babies, 6 babies had 4 bables<n><n>**Response:** 2 babies had 64 babies<n><n>### Input<n>**Input:** Anita and Brian share a pizza equally. Then they share the change between them equally.<n>**Solution:** Write a statement that calculates the share of each person.<n><n>### Example<n>[![Screenshot](/images/Practice/Solution123.png)](/images/Practice_Solution1_Image.png)<n><n>### **Solution**<n>```<n>Let total shares = n/2 -> n is the number of pizza slices<n>Anita's cake = 1/2 ( 3/5) n<n>Brian's cake = (4/5)(-1/2) n<n><n>Sub: 4n - 1/2 (n) - (3n) - 4n<n>= -3n + 3n<n>```<n><n>## Exercise: Solve this question<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>A man spends the first half of his monthly salary on food, and the second half on rent. If food costs $14 per day, and rent costs $500 per month, how much does he earn per month?<n><n>### Solution<n><n>A = T / 2<n><n>### Input and Challenge<n><n>Input:<n><n>A: 14<n><n>B: 500<n><n>Output:<n><n>5200<n><n>### Exercise and Solution<n>#### A man spends the first part of his monthly income on food, and the remaining part on rent. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:What are adult people usually expected to do? Choices:  A: shake hands B: own property C: pay bills D: smoke E: talk to each other<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question accurately using complete sentences.<n><n>### Question:What did you learn through this instruction? <n><n>### Output: What should be expected of the task creator for each of these tasks? <n><n>## Instant feedback on the results of testing<n><n>### Instructions:  Write a string that reads “Lesson: Question 87”<n><n>### Demosstration:<n>Input and Output: Lines of code: 21 <n><n>### Discussion: <n>In this task, we get the desired output by setting the variables in each line to the corresponding output, and then executing the program. Notice that the answer is on the next line of the output and that we do not need a new line.<n><n>Instant feedback on the results: The variable we chose is set to be an empty string, but the desired result is “”. This is because we tested the program with a specific input and expected the output to be “” if the input was not valid. This output was the empty string because the first input was not valid.<n><n>### Output and Instructions: <n>“”<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Input<n><n>```swift<n>let result = Lesson(instructions: "Question 67", demonstation: "The output is always empty"...).execute()<n>```<n><n>###  Instructions:  Answer the question accurately with a complete sentence.<n><n>## Discussion:  The result we got was that the answer was an empty string, but we had been looking for the empty string, as shown by the comments in the sample input/output. The answer is not empty because it does not match the expected output.<n><n>## Instructions:  Change the inputs so that the result is " "<n><n>### Demonsstration<n><n>Input and Output: lines of code: 22 Lines per line of code: 1 Output/instructions for each line: 16, 15 <n><n>### Demostration<n><n>### Discusion<n><n>We found that the string is being assigned the empty string. The last statement in the program is assigning its value of a string to the answer variable. We found that the answer had been set to the original statement, so we set it to be empty. The results of the program are correct.<n><n>##

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>### Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is C.<n><n>### Input<n><n>There are 5 dogs in a shelter. There are 8 rabbits in the shelter. Each day, the shelter spends $0.49, $1.01 and $0.50 to feed the dogs, rabbits and cats, respectively. The total daily budget is $21. The shelter manager wants to know which types of animals eat the most food. She asks you to write a computer program to determine this.<n><n>### Question<n><n>Write a program that has the following features:<n>* The dog's name is entered (Dog_Name), then the Rabbit's name is entered next (Rabbit_Name). The Rabbit_Name will be the same for all the rabbits, so Rabbit_Name can't be null-string. The Pet is named by taking Dog_Name substring 3 chars to index 6 chars (Dog_Name[3:6])+Rabbit_Name. Next the cats are named by Cat[6:11], where Cat[6:10] is the same for every cat, Cat[10] is calculated based on the Pet index. Finally the Budget is entered by totaling all Dog, Rabbit and Cat indices.<n>* The question should be presented to the user like this: Dog_Name<n>* The answers should be shown one by one, sorted by Pet name (Dog_Name, Rabbit_Name). Each of the Dog: "Dogs: 1, Rabbits: 11, Cats: 1; Total Budget: 21" should be shown to the user. Note that you should print the index and name of each entry.<n>* If the answer to the question has more than 10 entries, you should only print the first 10.<n><n>### Response<n><n>```text<n>Enter Dog_Name<n>Enter Rabbit_Name<n>Enter Budget<n>Dog_Name-Dog: 1  Rabbits: 38  Cats: 1  Total Budget: 40<n>Dog_Name<n>    Dog_Name=    -Dogs: 1  Rabs: 6  Cats: 7  Tot: 14<n>    Dog_Name2=    -Dogs 1:6  Rabs:27

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. We took a chunk of cheese from the fridge because it was old and used two different fungal species to test which one would grow faster. We ended up using Penicillium species to grow faster and that is why it was used and was in shower stall since it grew in the cheese.<n><n>- [Responses written by GitHub user](#responses-written-by-github-user)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>An operator has 1500 minutes. He spends 350 minutes talking to his friends and is paid $5 for every 10 minutes. 250 of the minutes are used to get calls from customers. He takes $7 for every 105 minutes he talks to a customer and $4 for every 30 minutes he talks to customers without being paid.<n><n>  How much did the operator make when all was said and done?<n><n><p><n>  **Answer:** After I set up the inequality, $\begin{array}{r} 1500 + 350 - 250 - { }^{10}(25 x 7) - { }^{15}(10 x 5)\\ - 30\\ \textrm{Minutes} & \textrm{Billable} \\ 1760 - 30\\ -{ }^{} = 796 \textrm{ Meters} \end{array}$<n></p><n>- [Responyes written by GitHub user](https://github.com/BearFitness/math-exercises/blob/master/inputs/Day14.tex#L10)<n><n>### Input<n>Cameron has worked at his company for exactly 2 years and 5 months, totaling 1078 work hours, for a total of $19,104 paid. This was paid on march 1

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many days did the dog want to eat his dog food?<n><n>### Reponse:<n>The correct answer is answer choice A; four days.<n><n>### In your school there is a cafeteria, and on average, 31 students eat in the cafeteria.
